intro: Monnina pittieri, commonly known as the yellow monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, with a distinctive reddish or purple hue on the underside. Monnina pittieri is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
